bug.short_desc: Bugzilla: Missing targets for devel versions of Firefox, Opera and Chrome

long_desc.thetext:
Thnaks, Helder. Added devel versions: Chrome 5.0, also Opera 10.50 as it will include the new JS engine Carakan. The other Opera versions fit into Opera 10 nicely, as they use the same engines. AFAIK Mozilla dumped FF 3.7 from schedule, so lets go with 3.6 till it has been decided if it's more than incremental improvements.
@Daniel for review/input.

(In reply to comment #1) > Thnaks, Helder.
Always a pleasure... :-)
> Added devel versions: Chrome 5.0, also Opera 10.50 as it will > include the new JS engine Carakan. The other Opera versions fit into Opera 10 > nicely, as they use the same engines.
Sounds reasonable.
> AFAIK Mozilla dumped FF 3.7 from > schedule, so lets go with 3.6 till it has been decided if it's more than > incremental improvements.
If you don't like "3.7" much, I'd suggest "Firefox.next" instead (codename currently being used [1]). FWIW, I'd prefer sticking with "3.7" (which is what appears in nightly builds about dialog and identifier string as well) and later change the label (which should keep specific tickets targeted, right?). ;-)
Not allowing to target specific version is, IMHO, less interesting as (for example) I've already noticed a couple of 3.7-specific minor regressions (apparently not affecting qooxdoo applications) I'm trying to reduce/debug in my spare time (I wonder if I still have any...? :-D).
[1] https://wiki.mozilla.org/Firefox#Firefox_major_release_tracking
Added Firefox 3.7 as well (they just made available an early 3.7a1), no matter what the official name might be for the final.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
